DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study investigate patient satisfaction treatment use new implantable neurostimulation system chronic pain trunk and/or limb .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes Study Using New Implantable Neurostimulation System Chronic Intractable Pain
DOC.criteria: Chronic intractable pain trunk and/or limb Documented history trunk and/or limb pain least 180 day Overall pain intensity least 5 010 numerical rating scale ( OPINRS11 ) past 180 day base subject recall Pass study site 's routine psychological/psychiatric evaluation within 180 day sign informed consent Subject willing able comply protocolrequired followup evaluation 18 year age old write informed consent obtain Subject sign inform consent Unable operate Precision Spectraâ„¢ System either self caregiver Primary source pain cancerrelated , pelvic , visceral , anginal migraine Overall pain intensity always 10 010 numerical rating scale ( OPINRS11 ) past 180 day base subject recall Is high surgical risk Currently anticoagulant medication discontinue perioperative period Subject require Magnetic Resonance Imaging ( MRI ) implant lead ( ) and/or Precision Spectra IPG Subject participate ( intend participate ) another investigational drug device clinical trial may influence data collect study Subjects already implant active implantable device ( ) treat pain ( IPGs , implantable drug pump , etc ) pacemaker Implantable Cardiac Defibrillator Patient woman pregnant ( urine pregnancy test must perform within 7 day prior stimulation trial procedure woman childbearing potential ) nursing intend become pregnant course trial . Failed achieve satisfactory relief stimulation trial phase
